title: January 6 Pardons
summary: Trump pardoned approximately 1,500 January 6 defendants including violent offenders convicted of assaulting police officers, undermining accountability for the Capitol attack.
keyFacts: Pardoned ~1,500 January 6 defendants including violent offenders
Included people convicted of assaulting police officers with deadly weapons
140+ police officers were injured during the attack, some with traumatic brain injuries
Pardons issued despite over 1,500 people being charged with federal crimes
Many pardoned individuals had been convicted by juries after trials
Proud Boys and Oath Keepers members convicted of seditious conspiracy were pardoned
Undermines rule of law and accountability for attack on democratic process
